Summary: UFO hovering near Dayton International Airport
divs: sighting detailslast night at 1;00 a.m. i went to my bedroom and lay down. after a minute i decided to get up and take a last look out my north-facing bedroom window (as i had done periodically throughout the evening) to see if the object(s) i had seen 2 nights previously were in sight. i noticed a star-like light in approximately the same position in the northeastern sky as i had 2 nights previously, so i got my bushnell binoculars to take a closer look. what i saw was apparently the same object i had observed before (ref mufon report 26 aug 2008: "ufos hovering over dayton international airport"). the object had white-yellow, blue, and red lights in the same configuration as before. i went out to the front yard at about 1:05 a.m. and observed the same object. it was in approximately the same position as 2 nights previous, but noticably higher and a little further southeast of the airport. i would estimate it to be about 1\4 to 1\2 mile southeast of the dayton airport and approximately 1000 ft. in altitude. i scanned the sky with and without binoculars to see if i could spot any other curious lights. all i could see were planets and stars. i could locate no other object as i had 2 nights previously. i went inside and woke my mom (approximately 1:10 a.m.) and she came to my bedroom window and observed the same phenomenon both with and without the binoculars. we watched it from the window for about 10 minutes then went out to the front yard and observed it from there as well. we stayed outside for about 10 minutes and then went back in. we continued to observed the object from my bedroom window and another north-facing window in another bedroom for about another 10 minutes. during this time my mom and i both saw what appeared to be a small cesna-sized plane slowly fly southeast from the direction of the airport toward the ufo but beneath and slightly south of it. this "plane" was probably 200 to 300 ft. below the ufo. the plane continued on it's same path until it was out of sight. i did not hear an engine sound from this second object and usually planes at that distance are easily audible. i see and hear these type planes every day at this airport and think it notable that i heard nothing on this night. it was now approximately 1:40 a.m. my mom went back to her room and i continued to monitor the object from the window. i lost the object behind some low clouds for about half an hour and didn't look for it again until about 2:30 a.m. i spotted it again in about the same position at about 2:45 a.m. and noticed through the binoculars that now there were no blue or red lights, but only white-yellow. i noted there seemed to be 3 main lights evenly spaced in a horizontal line with some fainter lights of the same color in-between the main ones. the ufo occasionally changed it's situation because sometimes it looked like an oval ring of white-yellow lights. i could just make out a shadowy oval or disk shaped form that was barely illuminated by the lights on the object. i noticed my mom's bedroom light still on at about 3:05 a.m. and went in to tell her that the object was still there but without the blue and red lights. she came to my room and watched it for about 10 minutes and then we both went to the front yard again and observed it with the binoculars. my mom saw the object at this time as a ring of white-yellow lights also. we went back inside and to our rooms to sleep (~ 3:20 a.m.) i last looked for the object at 4:30 a.m. and it was gone. both of us agreed we could not identify the object and had discussed the possibilities of what it might be throughout our night's observations. we just didn't know but were very curious. the viewing conditions i would describe as fair throughout the whole evening. it was partly cloudy with a rather low cloud ceiling. the object would dim and brighten throughout the whole viewing period due to clouds and haze passing over it. when there was a clearing in the cover, the object and stars were clearly visible.
